page.title: 14NATURE TRAIL, SOUTHWELL (3)
page.content: Today, the Nature Trail is used for {recreational purposes.} Families go for walks at the weekends along it. At the right time of year, you can see people picking elderberries and blackberries. They will use these for making jams and stewed fruit. At the Southwell end of the trail, some new house are being built in a development called{'Riverside Park'. These are mainly{detatched houses}and they cost between Â£5O,OOO and Â£7O,OOO each. At Maythorne, where there is still a farm, some old warehouses have been converted into{flats.} These cost about Â£3O,OOO each. There are also various craftsmen working here. There is a painter, a potter, a jam and sweet maker and a carpenter who makes furniture.
